timeline.bodyText: As discussed offline yesterday. We should put dynamicFilterPredicate in SplitContext rather than creating new interfaces in SPI.

timeline.bodyText: Just create a new SplitContext. We usually don't have mutable member variables.
timeline.author: highker
highker

timeline.bodyText: The prerequisite of having this new class is to remove those tests from AbstractTestQueries. 9925cd3 is an example for window function
timeline.author: highker

timeline.bodyText: Move all these to the same line with the previous line
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: It will exceed our limit in one line
replies.author: kewang1024

replies.bodyText: We don't have line break limit. Let's follow the coding style to break at .stream() only.

timeline.bodyText: the data structure is serializable. It's "// For local execution only; no need for serialization."
timeline.author: highker
highker

timeline.bodyText:
splitContext.getDynamicFilterPredicate().map(filter -> filter.transform(handle -> (HiveColumnHandle) handle).intersect(effectivePredicate)).orElse(effectivePredicate)
same for the other one
timeline.author: highker
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -164,9 +168,9 @@ public ConnectorPageSource createPageSource(
                 hiveSplit.getLength(),
                 hiveSplit.getFileSize(),
                 hiveSplit.getStorage(),
-                hiveLayout.getDomainPredicate()
-                        .transform(Subfield::getRootName)
-                        .transform(hiveLayout.getPredicateColumns()::get),
+                !splitContext.getDynamicFilterPredicate().isPresent()
+                        ? effectivePredicate
+                        : effectivePredicate.intersect(splitContext.getDynamicFilterPredicate().get().transform(handle -> (HiveColumnHandle) handle)),

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to enable broadcast join as well?
